decks.notes: This deck focuses on constantly controlling the board through a combination of disruptive spells like Abrupt Decay and Chalice of the Void, along with recurring removal in the form of Punishing Fire. The key strategy is to use Life from the Loam to continuously retrieve lands from the graveyard, fueling Knight of the Reliquary's ability to search for utility lands or pressure the opponent. The deck also utilizes Liliana of the Veil to disrupt the opponent's hand and board, while also applying pressure through efficient creatures like Dark Confidant and Gaddock Teeg.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and controlling the board. This is achieved through a combination of disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil. Additionally, the deck utilizes efficient creatures like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage to apply pressure and provide additional value. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the deck's three colors.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost and various other artifacts to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, Kozilek, and Emrakul. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to control the opponent's spells. The combination of big threats and mana acceleration allows the player to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells, making it difficult for the opponent to mount an effective defense.

The main concept of this deck is to use the powerful synergy between Elf creatures and various mana-generating cards to quickly ramp up and create a large board presence. By using cards like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith, the player can draw through their deck and find key combo pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth to finish off the opponent in one big swing. The inclusion of cards like Nissa, Vital Force and Reclamation Sage add versatility and resilience to the strategy, making it a formidable force in the Legacy format.

The main idea behind this deck is to generate a lot of mana quickly by using Elves and Gaea's Cradle, and then play powerful cards such as Craterhoof Behemoth or Nissa, Vital Force to win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order to tutor for specific creatures, and Wirewood Symbiote to protect key creatures and generate additional value. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large board presence and high-powered creatures to achieve victory.

The main idea behind this Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro - Burn deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of burn spells and efficient creatures. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Sulfuric Vortex, Chain Lightning, and Fireblast to keep the pressure up and finish off the opponent quickly. With a mix of burn spells, creatures with haste, and land fetch cards, this deck aims to consistently deal damage and control the pace of the game in order to secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through disruption spells like Spell Pierce and Force of Will, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and True-Name Nemesis. The deck also includes efficient removal with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Lightning Bolt. The addition of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provide additional value and win conditions. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of disruption, removal, and powerful threats.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of hand disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, along with counter spells like Force of Will. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells such as Toxic Deluge, Kolaghan's Command, and Fatal Push, while generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix. Additionally, the deck has a strong mana denial aspect with cards like Wasteland. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of disruption, removal, card advantage, and control.

The key concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy and control the game through a combination of powerful spells and versatile creatures. By using cards like Force of Will, Hymn to Tourach, and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's hand and game plan. Meanwhile, cards like Snapcaster Mage, Leovold, Emissary of Trest, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide card advantage and powerful threats to close out the game. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command to deal with opposing threats, making it a well-rounded control deck in the Legacy format.

Utilize quick and efficient graveyard manipulation to cheat powerful creatures into play early in the game, disrupting and overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to respond. The deck heavily relies on cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Exhume to bring back high-impact creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria. The inclusion of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Unmask helps protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with big threats and close out the game before they have a chance to recover.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer to flood the board with threats. The deck also includes disruption elements like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will to control the opponent's plays. It runs a low curve with a mix of burn spells and efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck aims to maintain tempo and keep the opponent on the back foot while pushing for victory through a combination of damage and disruption.

This deck focuses on utilizing the mana generation abilities of Elves to quickly assemble a powerful board state and win the game through the combination of creatures like Heritage Druid, Nettle Sentinel, and Quirion Ranger. With access to cards like Natural Order and Gaea's Cradle, the deck can easily ramp into big threats like Craterhoof Behemoth to close out the game. Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith provide additional consistency and card advantage to keep the engine running smoothly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using cheap spells and efficient creatures. The deck relies on cards like Stormchaser Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Delver of Secrets to apply pressure while backing them up with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt, Chain Lightning, and Price of Progress. The deck also includes powerful card selection tools like Ponder and Brainstorm, as well as disruption with Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats and ensure a fast clock.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy threats such as Young Pyromancer, Delver of Secrets, and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy, Daze, and Force of Will. The deck is able to apply early pressure with efficient creatures and burn spells, utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Gitaxian Probe to pick apart the opponent's board. By running disruptive elements like Wasteland and Deathrite Shaman, the deck aims to control the game tempo and force the opponent into making suboptimal plays.

This deck aims to be aggressive by denying opponent's resources with cards like Wasteland and Stifle while also disrupting their plays with countermagic like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck utilizes efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and Deathrite Shaman to apply pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder help maintain card advantage and ensure consistent draws. Overall, this deck is focused on being proactive and oppressive against the opponent.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disruption and card advantage to control the game. With a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and hand disruption, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up card advantage through powerful cards such as Snapcaster Mage, Leovold, Emissary of Trest, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The inclusion of Deathrite Shaman and Baleful Strix provides additional value and versatility. By maintaining control of the board and hand, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast the opponent to secure victory.
